item.description: All Subsets Regression What is all subsets regression? item.title: rmongodb 1.8.0
item.description: Today I’m introducing new version of rmongodb (which I started to maintain) – v1.8.0. Install it from github: library(devtools) install_github(“mongosoup/rmongodb@v1.8.0”) Release version will be uploaded to CRAN shortly. This release brings a lot of improvements to rmongodb: Now rmongodb correctly handles arrays. mongo.bson.to…

item.title: Log analysis GUI tools
item.description: Log analysis is important to both troubleshoot and understand network devices behaviour. Tail/less/grep are great tools that can help to filter and search hundreds or thousands lines of logs. If you prefer a GUI there are a couple of alternatives that can fit well…

item.title: A Grammar of Models?
item.description: I’m also really interested in statistical learning as a family of modeling techniques, a kind of fitting them together very well and forming a grammer of models. You can make a new model by joing things together, just like the grammer of graphics by which you can come up with a new graphic that is just a new arrangment of existing…

item.title: Statistics Can Do Anything?
item.description: Sometimes people are fond of saying: I think that this is the equivalent of saying: …What I am saying is true because of my argument. And statistics… The same goes for statistics, you could perform a variety of tests to support a particular point. The reader also has a responsibility to evaluate their use of tools to construct and support their…

item.title: fping
item.description: Ping is one of the most useful tools to test network connectivity, sometimes it is the first step for troubleshooting and getting the “!” (if you work on Cisco devices) can be a big satisfaction…

item.title: Let's Python!
item.description: Inspired by the CodeAcademy project, I’ve decided to learn a programming language this year. Back in high school I’ve learnt Pascal, Delphi, Assembly and C but many years passed so I forgot all the sintax but not the basics…

item.title: FutureMed Day 4 - Philip Low, Andrew Hessel, a Visit to Intuitive Surgical, and More
item.description: Yesterday we finished another exceptional 14 hours of medicine, complete with regenerative biology, cutting edge neuroscience, a trip to go play with da Vinci surgical robots and a paranoia-inducing talk on how the future of synthetic biology will present tremendous challenges and opportunities for the world…

item.description: Bioness out of Valencia, California has received U.S. FDA approval for its NESS L300 Plus System, a combination of the NESS L300 Foot Drop System with a thigh stimulation device…

item.title: Electromechanical Wave Imaging Non-Invasively Maps Electrical Activation of the Heart
item.description: Researchers from Columbia Engineering School developed a new method to non-invasively map the electrical activation of the heart. The technique, called Electromechanical Wave Imaging (EWI), uses ultrasound waves to detect very small deformations following the electrical activation of the heart…
